焼のり: (やきのり) - baked seaweed; toasted seaweed
焼べる: (くべる) - to throw on the fire; to burn
焼もち: (やきもち) - jealousy; roasted rice cake
焼もちを妬く: (やきもちをやく) - to be jealous
焼もちを焼く: (やきもちをやく) - to be jealous
焼付く: (やきつく) - to be scorched into/to be seared into; to make a strong impression/to be etched in (one's memory)
焼付ける: (やきつける) - to bake; to plate; to print; to burn or bake into; to burn into one's memory
焼印: (やきいん) - brand (burnt-in mark of identification); branding iron
焼印を押す: (やきいんをおす) - to brand (cattle, etc.)
焼却: (しょうきゃく) - incineration; destroy by fire
焼却灰: (しょうきゃくばい) - incinerated ash; burned ash; ash
焼土: (しょうど) - burning earth, e.g. for sterilization and converting compost
焼型: (やきがた) - mold (e.g. cake mold); mould; baking pan; bread pan
焼場: (やきば) - crematory; place where things are burned
焼塩: (やきしお) - roasted salt; parched salt; baked salt
焼売: (シューマイ) - steamed meat dumpling (Chinese-style) (chi: shāomài)
焼失: (しょうしつ) - being destroyed by fire
焼失を免れる: (しょうしつをまぬかれる) - to be saved from the fire
焼夷弾: (しょういだん) - fire bomb; incendiary bomb
焼打: (やきうち) - setting on fire; setting afire
焼打ち: (やきうち) - setting on fire; setting afire
焼損: (しょうそん) - burnout; loss of combustion
焼毀: (しょうき) - completely destroying by fire
焼海苔: (やきのり) - baked seaweed; toasted seaweed
焼火ばし: (やけひばし) - burning-hot tongs; red-hot tongs
焼火箸: (やけひばし) - burning-hot tongs; red-hot tongs
焼物: (やきもの) - earthenware/pottery/porcelain/china; flame-broiled food (esp. fish); tempered blade
焼畑: (やいばた) - swidden; land made arable by slash-and-burn agriculture
焼筆: (やきふで) - wooden stick with a burned tip (used to create underdrawings)
焼肉: (やきにく) - yakiniku/Japanese dish of grilled meat similar to Korean barbecue; roasted meat/grill
焼肉定食: (やきにくていしょく) - set meal with grilled meat
焼芋: (やきいも) - roasted sweet potato; baked sweet potato
焼芋屋: (やきいもや) - sweet potato shop; sweet potato seller
焼藷: (やきいも) - roasted sweet potato; baked sweet potato
焼討: (やきうち) - setting on fire; setting afire
焼討ち: (やきうち) - setting on fire; setting afire
焼豚: (やきぶた) - roast pork; baseball fan
焼跡: (やけあと) - ruins of a fire; fire-devastated area
焼身: (しょうしん) - burning oneself (to death); self-immolation
焼身自殺: (しょうしんじさつ) - self-immolation; burning oneself to death; suicide by fire
焼酎ハイボール: (しょうちゅうハイボール) - shochu high-ball
焼酎漬け: (しょうちゅうづけ) - fruit, etc. preserved in shochu
焼酒: (やけざけ) - drowning one's cares in drink; drinking in desperation
焼野原: (やけのはら) - burnt field; burnt area
焼鍋: (やきなべ) - cooking pot (for roasting, broiling, etc.)
焼鏝: (やきごて) - soldering iron/hot iron; brand/mark/stigma
焼飲み: (やけのみ) - drowning one's cares in drink
焼餅: (やきもち) - jealousy; roasted rice cake
焼餅を妬く: (やきもちをやく) - to be jealous
焼餅を焼く: (やきもちをやく) - to be jealous
焼香台: (しょうこうだい) - altar, stand or table for burning incense
焼鳥: (やきとり) - yakitori; chicken pieces (or sometimes beef or pork offal) grilled on a skewer
煉り上げる: (ねりあげる) - to knead well; to polish/to refine
煉り味噌: (ねりみそ) - miso mixed with sugar and sake, thickened by stirring over low heat
煉り塀: (ねりべい) - mud and tile wall topped with tiles
煉り物: (ねりもの) - paste products (incl. sweets, fish paste, etc.); parade float/procession
煉り紅: (ねりべに) - muddy colored lipstick or rouge
煉り餌: (ねりえさ) - paste bird feed; paste fishing bait
煉り香: (ねりこう) - (incense) pastille; round cake of incense, esp. used in incense ceremony
煉る: (ねる) - to knead/to thicken into a paste (stirring over a flame); to polish (a plan, etc.)/to refine/to elaborate/to work out; to train/to drill/to exercise; (練る only) to gloss (silk)/to soften/to degum; to tan (leather); (also written as 錬る) to temper (steel); (also written as 邌る) to walk in procession/to parade/to march
煉れる: (ねれる) - to be well-kneaded; to be seasoned/to be experienced/to be mature and well-rounded
煉丹: (れんたん) - elixir of life (prepared from cinnabar in ancient China)
煉丹術: (れんたんじゅつ) - alchemy; art of making elixirs
煉屏: (ねりべい) - mud and tile wall topped with tiles
煉香: (ねりこう) - (incense) pastille; round cake of incense, esp. used in incense ceremony
